page.title: 06Farming in the Cowlinge area
page.content: This area is a mainly arable farming area. The main crop this year was wheat, the reat was barley and oil-seed rape. It was a fairly poor cereal harvest this year due to the cold wet conditions this summer. There are one or two small meadows in Cowlinge, these are used to graze small herd of bullocks and also a small flock of sheep. There is a prdigree herd of Golden Guernsey dairy cows at Little Bradley.The herd is now too big for the EEC milk quota and is having to be reduced. They are also crossed with a Hereford bull to produce good beef cattle.
